page.title: 17WHADDON CHURCH FETE
page.content: Every year in June or July Whaddon Church holds a fete. This is held in Whaddon House. We asked Mrs Weatherby about it. She says that it has been held at Whaddon House for 15 years. The owners welcome all the villagers on this day as there is no rectory in Whaddon now. The Rector lives at the rectory in Newton Longville. We were quite amazed to hear that during those 15 years there had only been one year when the fete was held on a wet day. Whaddon First school children usually take part in the church fete. This year the older children at the school did some country dancing. We all look forward to this special day when we can spend some time in the beautiful garden of Whaddon House.
